unit.comment: /*------------------------------------------------------------------------- * * pg_dumpall.c * * Portions Copyright (c) 1996-2018, PostgreSQL Global Development Group * Portions Copyright (c) 1994, Regents of the University of California * * pg_dumpall forces all pg_dump output to be text, since it also outputs * text into the same output stream. * * src/bin/pg_dump/pg_dumpall.c * *------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
/* version string we expect back from pg_dump */
unit.function_decl: static int runPgDump(const char *dbname, const char *create_opts);
static PGconn *connectDatabase(const char *dbname, const char *connstr, const char *pghost, const char *pgport, const char *pguser, trivalue prompt_password, bool fail_on_error);
unit.comment: /* In this mode DDL statements include YB specific * metadata such as tablet partitions. */
/* Dump only one DB specified by '--database' argument. */

function.name: main
help
dropRoles
dumpRoles

unit.comment: /* * Dump role memberships. This code is used for 8.1 and later servers. * * Note: we expect dumpRoles already created all the roles, but there is * no membership yet. */

function.name: dumpRoleMembership

unit.comment: /* * Dump group memberships from a pre-8.1 server. It's annoying that we * can't share any useful amount of code with the post-8.1 case, but * the catalog representations are too different. * * Note: we expect dumpRoles already created all the roles, but there is * no membership yet. */

function.name: dumpGroups
dropTablespaces
dumpTablespaces

unit.comment: /* * Vanilla PG does not have strings in spcoptions column in pg_tablespace. * Since YB tablespaces have JSON strings in its options, process using * appendRelOptionsArray and append to 'buf'. */

function.name: ybProcessTablespaceSpcOptions
dropDBs
dumpUserConfig
dumpDatabases
runPgDump

unit.comment: /* * buildShSecLabels * * Build SECURITY LABEL command(s) for a shared object * * The caller has to provide object type and identity in two separate formats: * catalog_name (e.g., "pg_database") and object OID, as well as * type name (e.g., "DATABASE") and object name (not pre-quoted). * * The command(s) are appended to "buffer". */

function.name: buildShSecLabels

unit.comment: /* * Make a database connection with the given parameters. An * interactive password prompt is automatically issued if required. * * If fail_on_error is false, we return NULL without printing any message * on failure, but preserve any prompted password for the next try. * * On success, the global variable 'connstr' is set to a connection string * containing the options used. */

function.name: connectDatabase

unit.comment: /* ---------- * Construct a connection string from the given keyword/value pairs. It is * used to pass the connection options to the pg_dump subprocess. * * The following parameters are excluded: * dbname - varies in each pg_dump invocation * password - it's not secure to pass a password on the command line * fallback_application_name - we'll let pg_dump set it * ---------- */

function.name: constructConnStr
executeQuery
executeCommand
dumpTimestamp
